The most stable phase of CsPbI
while its cubic phase is metastable at room temperature.
peaks of the cubic phase shifted toward lower angles with
increasing iodine content. Lattice spacings were calculated
from the XRD peak of the (200) crystal plane by using Bragg’s

I), following Vegard’s law. The ionic radii of Br
fold coordination site are 196 and 220 pm,

remarkable diﬀerence in their FT-IR spectra. Speciﬁc
absorption peaks attributed to carboxylate and ammonium
salts were observed, revealing surface modiﬁcation by oleate
dispersions of the NCs under white light and 365 nm
ultraviolet (UV) light. Their color under white light changed
with changing iodide composition. The apparent color might
be aﬀected by the eﬃciency of their PL as well as their light
absorption. The PL color under UV light changed from bluish-
green to red with increasing iodide composition.
the NC dispersions. The absorption edge red-shifted as the
calculated from the absorption spectra by the following
semiconductor. The determined band gap of the NCs linearly
This is explained by the change in the band gap of the NCs as
a result of the changing halide composition. According to the
, a change in the band gap is
mainly caused by a shift of the valence band maximum, which
is primarily composed of the p-orbitals of the halides.
The PL spectra of the NC dispersions are compared in
B. The NCs exhibit eﬃcient PL emission through

the band gap. The chromaticity coordinates converted from
the PL spectra changed from (0.058, 0.656) to (0.680, 0.258)
by tuning the contents of Br and I, as shown in
closest to the coordinates (0.170, 0.797) of the green vertex of
the BT.2020 standard. To realize the ideal emission color at
the green vertex, a narrower PL peak is required to improve the
green color purity. As shown in
the halide composition became closer to containing only
bromide or iodide. The increase in the FWHM could be
explained by the widening of the particle size distribution and
individual NCs. Swarnkar et al. synthesized CsPbBr
were 11 nm in size by the hot-injection method and found that
there was no signiﬁcant diﬀerence between the PL peak widths
from their ensemble and single nanocrystals.
